ch.epfl.lis.wingj.batch

Class ExperimentBatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.epfl.lis.wingj.batch.ExperimentBatch

  • public class ExperimentBatch
extends java.lang.Object
    Describes a batch of experiments.

    Examples are provided for processing many experiments part of a batch. An experiment should be seen as the quantification of a single biological system (or organ system or body system).

    Batch processing of experiments will be made possible through a graphical user interface in a future release of WingJ. The code available in this package has been implemented as a first step to achieve this and to already enable batch processing inside the frame of this sandbox. Note that the code below has not been optimized and has only been used so to run very specific experiments. Yet the methods have been designed to be modular and thus easily reusable.

    Please read carefully the comments as they can be of great help for adapting the code code for different applications.

    Version:
    December 16, 2012
    Author:
    Thomas Schaffter (thomas.schaff...@gmail.com)
    See Also:
    Experiment

      • exportAggExpressionMapsForWingViewer

        public void exportAggExpressionMapsForWingViewer(java.lang.String directory,
                                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> inputFilenames,
                                        java.util.List<ij.ImagePlus> expressionMaps)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Exports aggregated expression maps and names them so that they can be used by the wing viewer available on the project website (lis.epfl.ch/wingj). Options:
        • Pent2-5 mutant experiments contain the string "pent2-5" in their filename
        • The first token of the filename of an aggregated map is the gene name (separated by '_')
        • The age token ends with 'H' and the extracted age is somehow rounded to multiple of 10 hours (see below)
        • Ages are rounded to the nearest 10
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • aggregateStructureModelsDemo

        public static void aggregateStructureModelsDemo()
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Aggregates the structure models of many experiments and export them (mean, mean+std and mean-std structures) to files.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • aggregateStructureExpressionModelsAsyncDemo

        public static void aggregateStructureExpressionModelsAsyncDemo(java.lang.String outputDirectory)
                                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Aggregates models but where the number of experiments used to generated the aggregated model is not the same as the experiments used to generated the aggregated expression maps. The output directory must includes the final separator ('/' or '\').

        TODO: Optimize for memory.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
